title: The Case of the Lost Treasure

narrative: Alex totally loved this amazing pirate adventure book from the library.
It had incredible treasure maps and epic sea battles that made Alex dream about sailing adventures.
But when it was time to return the book... disaster! The thing had completely disappeared!

choice_points.question: Alex needs to turn into a detective to solve this mystery. What should they do first?

options.text: Search every room in the house super carefully
Make a list of everywhere the book went with them

consequences.text: Alex searches through bedrooms, living room, and even closets... finding tons of random lost stuff but no treasure book.
Making a list of everywhere the book traveled - bedroom, kitchen table, backpack, park - helps Alex remember some important clues.

continuation: The librarian explains this is a really special book that lots of kids love reading.
Alex remembers Mom mentioning something about reading outside yesterday at the park.
That gives Alex a new idea about where to look next!

reflections.question: Have you ever lost something really important to you? How did it feel and what did you do?
What's one strategy you could use to keep track of borrowed books or other special things?

narrative: Alex had gotten completely hooked on this awesome pirate adventure book from the library.
The book had detailed treasure maps and exciting sea battles that sparked incredible daydreams about sailing adventures.
When the time came to return this beloved library book... total disaster struck! The irreplaceable book had mysteriously vanished.

choice_points.question: Alex decides to approach this investigation like a real detective. What's the best first move?

options.text: Do systematic searches throughout the entire house, checking every possible spot
Create a timeline of the book's journey through different locations and activities

consequences.text: Room-by-room searches turn up several forgotten belongings... but somehow the missing book remains nowhere to be found.
Carefully reconstructing the book's recent travels - bedroom reading sessions, kitchen homework time, backpack trips, outdoor adventures - reveals some crucial patterns.

continuation: The concerned librarian emphasizes the book's special value, noting its popularity among young adventure fans throughout the community.
Family discussions uncover valuable information... particularly Mom's memory of yesterday's outdoor reading session at the neighborhood park.
Based on all the evidence gathered, Alex realizes the park deserves the most thorough investigation.
Racing back to the park, Alex discovers the precious book safely tucked under the old picnic table where yesterday's reading adventure had happened.

reflections.question: Think about times when you've lost something valuable - what investigation strategies actually worked best?
How could you develop a better system for tracking and protecting borrowed books or other important items?
